1516741810_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
A blog/site that evaluates sites created on ZeroNet: With screenshot, how well is it working, user activity around it,
possible improvement points, etc.

I think it would be really useful for new users and if someone create a nice one with quality content I would be happy to promote it on ZeroHello "More sites" section. :)
A site that aggregates ZeroNet blogs into one feed, so you can find new blogs to follow.

1517065590_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body: If you are running ZeroNet in `--debug` mode and have coffeescript compiler included (bundled for windows), then [it will compile the all.js and all.css files by itself](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/getting_started/#debug-mode-features).
can you check your `coffee --version` ? (I have not tried yet, but probably the recently released coffeescript 2.x is not supported yet)

1524258152_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiK.body:
It's only merged when running it in debug mode. The easiest way to disable it change the filename to anything else. If that not an option for you I can add a command line argument that disable the merging.

According to my experience requesting,downloading and parsing one css/js file is significantly faster, than many files. (even from localhost)
